title: Pride of Britain Awards: Craig Revel Horwood makes a rare appearance with partner Jonathan Myring
text:
They've been together since February 2018 after being introduced backstage at a Strictly Come Dancing tour.

And Craig Revel Horwood made a rare red carpet appearance with partner Jonathan Myring at the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening.

The Strictly judge, 54, dazzled in a fuchsia satin suit as he joined his partner, who stunned in an equally eye-catching lilac suit.

Night out: Craig Revel Horwood made a rare red carpet appearance with partner Jonathan Myring at the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening

Commanding attention, Craig looked fab-u-lous in his bright pink two-piece, which featured a black piping detail.

He teamed his ensemble with a black shirt and tie, and added a pair of glittering black studded loafers.

Meanwhile, Jonathan wowed in a pale purple number, which he paired with a crisp white shirt and a silver tie.

Competing with his other half in the shoe department, Jonathan rocked a pair of shiny silver brogues.

Just the two of us: The Strictly judge, 54, dazzled in a fuchsia satin suit as he joined his partner who stunned in an equally eye-catching lilac suit

Catching the eye: Commanding attention, Craig looked fab-u-lous in his bright pink two-piece, which featured a black piping detail

The happy couple beamed from ear to ear as they posed together at the star-studded event.

Craig was later seen posing with fellow Strictly judges Shirley Ballass and Motsi Mabuse, as well as the Special Recognition award winner, Margaret Walker.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Congratulations: Craig was later seen posing with fellow Strictly judges Shirley Ballass and Motsi Mabuse, as well as the Special Recognition award winner, Margaret Walker

Lovely: The Strictly judges and Margaret flashed dazzling smiles as they posed with her special recognition award

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The duo's appearance comes after Craig recently revealed he and his boyfriend have discussed having children in the future.

The Strictly Come Dancing star played Miss Hannigan in the UK touring production of Annie and the role has got him thinking about what it would be like to start a family.

Family: The duo's appearance comes after Craig recently revealed he and his boyfriend have discussed having children in the future

He told The Sun: 'There are so many children out there just like in Annie, who are orphaned for whatever reason and they just need a loving family.

'But I am waiting to see how our relationship develops and if it’s solid enough and a good base to bring children into it. It certainly needs a lot of planning.

'You are under great scrutiny when you are adopting, more so than natural parents. There are a lot of interviews, screenings etc.'
